body:
# GlusterFS CLI bindings - Crystal

## Super Simple

```crystal
require "glustercli"

cli = GlusterCLI::CLI.new

# List all Peers
puts cli.list_peers

# List all Volumes information
puts cli.list_volumes

# List all Volumes with status
puts cli.list_volumes(status: true)

# Info of a single Volume
puts cli.volume("gvol1").info

# Volume info with status info
puts cli.volume("gvol1").info(status: true)

# JSON output
puts cli.list_peers.to_json
puts cli.list_volumes(status: true).to_json
```

## Installation

Add this to your application's shard.yml:

```yaml
dependencies:
  glustercli:
    github: aravindavk/glustercli-crystal
```

types.name: GlusterCLI
types.doc:
Gluster CLI bindings

Create `CLI` instance and execute Gluster commands.

Example:
```
require "glustercli"

cli = GlusterCLI::CLI.new

peers = cli.list_peers

volumes = cli.list_volumes

# List Volumes with realtime status
volumes = cli.list_volumes(status: true)
```

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Instance of Gluster CLI.

Example:
```
require "glustercli"

cli = GlusterCLI::CLI.new
puts cli.list_peers
```

Set *current_hostname* if it is different from the `hostname`.
Gluster pool list command shows "localhost" for the node where
the command is run. *current_hostname* will replace the references
of the localhost.

Example:
```
cli = GlusterCLI::CLI.new
cli.current_hostname = "server1.example.com"
```

Set *gluster_executable* option if Gluster is installed in non-standard
location.

Example:
```
cli = GlusterCLI::CLI.new
cli.gluster_executable = "/usr/local/sbin/gluster"
```

instance_methods.name: add_peer
instance_methods.doc:
Add new peer to the Cluster

Example:
```
cli.add_peer("server2.example.com")
```

instance_methods.name: create_volume
instance_methods.doc:
Create a new Gluster Volume

Example:
```
opts = VolumeCreateOptions.new
opts.replica_count = 3

bricks = [
  "server1.example.com:/bricks/gvol1/brick1/brick",
  "server2.example.com:/bricks/gvol1/brick2/brick",
  "server3.example.com:/bricks/gvol1/brick3/brick",
]
cli.create_volume("gvol1", bricks, opts)
```

instance_methods.name: list_peers
instance_methods.doc:
List all peers of the Cluster

Example:
```
puts cli.list_peers
```

instance_methods.name: list_volumes
instance_methods.doc:
List all Volumes of the Cluster

Example:
```
puts cli.list_volumes

# List all Volumes with realtime status
puts cli.list_volumes(status: true)
```

instance_methods.name: local_metrics
instance_methods.doc:
Collect the Local metrics

Example:
```
cli = GlusterCLI::CLI.new
cli.local_metrics
cli.local_metrics(log_dir: "/var/log/glusterfs")
```

instance_methods.name: peer
instance_methods.doc:
Get the Peer Object

Example:
```
peer = cli.peer("server1.example.com")
peer.remove
```

instance_methods.name: volume
instance_methods.doc:
Get the Volume Object

Example:
```
volume = cli.volume("gvol1")
volume.start
```

instance_methods.name: delete
instance_methods.doc:
Delete a Gluster Volume

Example:
```
cli.volume("gvol1").delete
```

instance_methods.name: info
instance_methods.doc:
Get Volume info and realtime Status

Example:
```
cli.volume("gvol1").info
cli.volume("gvol1").info(status: true)
```

def.name: info
def.body:
if status
  return _status
end
rc, resp, err = @cli.execute_gluster_cmd(["volume", "info", @name, "--xml"])
if rc != 0
  raise(CommandException.new(rc, err))
end
document = XML.parse(resp)
vols = Volume.group_subvols(Volume.parse_info(document))
if vols.size == 0
  raise(CommandException.new(-1, "Invalid Volume name"))
end
vols[0]

def.name: option_set
def.body:
cmd = ["volume", "set", @name]
key_values.each do |key, value|
  cmd << key
  cmd << value
end
@cli.execute_gluster_cmd(cmd)

instance_methods.name: start
instance_methods.doc:
Start a Gluster Volume

Example:
```
cli.volume("gvol1").start

# To start with *force* option
cli.volume("gvol1").start(force: true)
```

instance_methods.name: stop
instance_methods.doc:
Stop a Gluster Volume

Example:
```
cli.volume("gvol1").stop

# To stop with *force* option
cli.volume("gvol1").stop(force: true)
```

def.name: new
def.body:
x = allocate
if x.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(x)
end
x

def.name: subvol_size
def.body:
if @replica_count > 1
  @replica_count
else
  if @disperse_count > 0
    @disperse_count
  else
    1
  end
end
